info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Hendersonville, or near Pleasant Ridge State Park, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Landrum, Slater-Marietta, Paris Mountain State Park, Tigerville, Lake Robinson, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Campobello, Travelers Rest and Tuxedo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
